title: Welcome to My Data Science Portfolio
text:
Welcome to my data science portfolio! This site shows my journey learning data science and analytics. Here you’ll find projects that demonstrate what I’ve learned and discovered.


This portfolio shows my work learning data science. Each project includes:

My code with documentation
Visualizations I created
What I learned and discovered

I built this site using Quarto and host it on GitHub Pages.




Programming: Python, Pandas for data analysis
Visualization: Creating charts with Matplotlib and Seaborn
Data Collection: Getting data from files, websites, and APIs
Analysis: Finding patterns and answering questions with data







Learn how I explore datasets to find interesting patterns and answer questions.



See how I gather data from different sources and prepare it for analysis.



See how I tackle a data science project beginning to end.



Thanks for visiting! Feel free to explore my projects and see what I’m learning.

title: About Me
text:
Background
I am a driven, people focused individual studying at Brigham Young university. I am in my third year, and I am studying Statistics with an emphasis in Data Science. I was first inspired to do this by my love for communication and business as well as my love for math and problem solving. My goal is to help people make informed, data-driven decisions to help people and grow businesses. I am currently doing research in the Marriott Business School learning about the sociological effect of AI adoption in the workplace.

title: About Me
text:
Education

[Statistics] - [Brigham Young University], [2027]
Relevant Coursework: Statistics, Data Analysis, Programming, Information Systems, and Business

title: About Me
text:
Skills & Interests

Technical Skills

Programming: Python, R
Data Analysis: Pandas, NumPy
Visualization: Matplotlib, Seaborn
Machine Learning: Scikit-learn
Tools: Jupyter Notebooks, Git/GitHub -Quarto: For report writing and presenting visuals
Excel: Experienced in built-in methods as well as VBA (Openpyxl for python integration)



Areas of Interest

I am interested in financial analytics especially the interaction between the price of natural resources with the stock prices of companies that buy them
I am curious about neural networks and complex machine learning techniques



Hobbies

I love backpacking and hiking
In my free time I enjoy reading and playing sports
I ski and love the winter

title: About Me
text:
Goals
I aim to use data science techniques to allow myself to broaden the scope of my questions. I plan to develop skills that enable me to analyze complex datasets and derive meaningful insights. I hope to utilize these skills in the long term to make impactful contributions in my field and to have the skills to answer my own questions using data.

title: About Me
text:
Experience

Research Assistant — Brigham Young University, Marriott School of Business (Strategic Management)
Provo, UT · Apr 2025 – Present

Proofread statistical components of curriculum materials and academic research articles

Migrated a large-scale database from Snowflake to a Linux-based university supercomputer

Analyzed cooperative research survey data using Multinomial and Ordinal Logistic Regression to generate insights on employee perceptions of AI adoption

Computer Programmer (Front-End) — Brigham Young University, Marriott School of Business (ILABZ)
Provo, UT · Mar 2024 – Apr 2025

Built React components using TypeScript as part of a 7-member development team

Developed and maintained five learning-oriented web applications focused on stock markets and international trade

Social Media Specialist — North Carolina Raleigh Mission
Raleigh, NC · Jan 2022 – Jun 2022

Managed monthly social media marketing campaigns using Meta Business Suite

Increased monthly audience reach while maintaining the existing budget
